intro: Chaenorhinum langei, commonly known as the Lange's horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and related species. The plant is characterized by its striking, colorful flowers that resemble horns, hence its common name. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. The leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
